signals.title: United Nations Announces Global Economic Report with Projections of Slower Growth
signals.summary: UN released World Economic Situation and Prospects 2026 report projecting the world economy faces risk of prolonged period of slower growth compared to pre-pandemic era. Global growth expected at 3.3% in 2025-2026, below historical average of 3.7%.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals potential structural shift in global growth trajectory - indicates move from post-pandemic recovery to new normal of permanently lower growth rates. Could trigger policy shifts across nations and international institutions.
signals.impact_area: Global macroeconomic stability, fiscal policy recalibration

signals.title: OECD Announces Historic Agreement on Global Minimum Tax Package - Pillar Two Side-by-Side Arrangement
signals.summary: 147 countries and jurisdictions within OECD/G20 BEPS framework agreed on 'side-by-side' arrangement for coordinated global minimum tax operations in digitalized economy. Represents comprehensive political and technical agreement after months of negotiation.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals fundamental reshaping of international corporate taxation - move toward harmonized global tax rules challenges traditional national tax sovereignty. Early indicator of convergence on taxing digital economy, with implications for capital flows and FDI patterns.
signals.impact_area: International governance, corporate finance, sovereign fiscal policy

signals.title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) Enters Definitive Phase - First Global Carbon Border Tax
signals.summary: EU CBAM moves from transitional to definitive phase on January 1, 2026. Importers must purchase CBAM certificates for emissions embedded in goods (€70-€100 per tonne CO2). Covers cement, steel, aluminum, fertilizers, electricity, hydrogen.
signals.why_weak_signal: Represents first fully operational border carbon adjustment policy globally - signals shift from voluntary climate action to mandatory trade-linked climate enforcement. Could trigger protectionist trade responses and accelerate fragmentation of global trade system.
signals.impact_area: Global trade system, climate policy implementation, industrial competitiveness

signals.title: WHO Releases Updated HIV Clinical Management Recommendations - Shift to Simplified Treatment Protocols
signals.summary: WHO updated HIV clinical guidelines shifting to dolutegravir-based regimens, long-acting injectable therapy for adherence, and simplified TB prevention (3HP). Emphasizes treatment simplification and improved adherence for country programs.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals evolution in global health protocols toward simplified, scalable treatment models - weak indicator of shift from complex to accessible healthcare. Could influence how health systems in developing countries structure medication supply chains and treatment programs.
signals.impact_area: Global health access, medication supply chains, treatment outcomes

signals.title: ILO Announces Global Labour Market Trends Update - Seafarer Minimum Wage Increased
signals.summary: ILO releasing 2026 update on global labour market trends and agreed landmark increase in seafarer minimum wage from US$673 to US$690 (Jan 2026), US$704 (Jan 2027), US$715 (Jan 2028). Represents coordinated global labor standard increase.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals coordinated push for wage standardization in maritime sector - weak signal of broader movement toward global labor floor standards amid inflationary pressures. May precede similar efforts in other industries facing global supply chain restructuring.
signals.impact_area: Global labor standards, maritime wages, cost structures for international shipping

signals.title: IMF Reports Elevated Financial Stability Risks - Emerging Market Debt Vulnerabilities and Repricing Concerns
signals.summary: IMF Global Financial Stability Report warns of elevated financial stability risks amid stretched asset valuations, sovereign bond market pressures, and rising nonbank financial institution roles. Disorderly global market repricing identified as most acute risk to global economy in 2026.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals potential inflection point in financial markets - indicates conditions resembling pre-crisis environments (high leverage, stretched valuations, nonbank intermediation). Early warning of possible market correction with cascade effects on emerging markets and developing economies.
signals.impact_area: Global financial system stability, emerging market capital flows, asset pricing

signals.title: Bank of Japan Signals Continued Interest Rate Increases - Exit from Ultra-Loose Monetary Policy Accelerating
signals.summary: BOJ Governor Ueda publicly reaffirmed intention to continue raising benchmark rates if economic and price trends align with forecasts. BOJ raised rates to 0.75% in December (highest since 1995), with markets expecting 1.0% by July 2026 and up to 1.25% by year-end.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals acceleration of global monetary policy tightening cycle beyond Western central banks - weak indicator of coordinated exit from ultra-loose policies. Could trigger currency volatility, emerging market capital outflows, and yen appreciation impacts on global trade.
signals.impact_area: Global monetary conditions, exchange rates, emerging market financing

signals.title: US Withdrawal from 66 International Organizations - Unprecedented Pullback from Multilateral System
signals.source_name: Trump Administration / Union of Concerned Scientists
signals.summary: Trump Administration announced US withdrawal from 66 international organizations including UNFCCC, IPCC, and multiple UN agencies. Presidential memorandum directs US departments to immediately withdraw from dozens of conventions and treaties affecting 31 UN entities.
signals.why_weak_signal: Signals fundamental restructuring of multilateral global governance - represents unprecedented scale of unilateral withdrawal from international institutions. Weak indicator of potential bifurcation of global system into competing blocs with separate institutional frameworks for climate, trade, health, and development.
signals.impact_area: Global governance, climate cooperation, international treaties, development aid
